alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 08 at 10:06PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Phillips. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 PM MDT, Montana Department of Transportation and local law enforcement reported flooding in the advisory area. This will cause small stream flooding. Also, gage readings indicate rising water with areas of flooding on Beaver Creek south of Saco across central and southern Phillips Counties. - There is water running across US 191 at mile post 134 about 25 miles south of Malta. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
